description: Bustling pub/restaurant and art gallery, with live music, DJs and a huge waterside terrace.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes:
Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows
                    the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email
                    about any changes to the programme that might affect your
                    visit.

factsheet.heading: About Number 90
paragraphs: Number 90 Bar & Kitchen is a vibrant creative space in the heart of Hackney Wick, set along the scenic canal. Originally part of an industrial warehouse, the building retains its raw, open-plan feel while blending in contemporary design touches — from its striking reclaimed wood features to large-scale art murals created by local and international artists.

Since opening, Number 90 has become a cultural hub, bringing together food, art, and music under one roof. It’s home to an ever-changing exhibition of artwork, a seasonal menu that celebrates fresh and locally sourced produce, and a diverse programme of live music and DJ events, ranging from electronic and house music to jazz and soul.

Hideout – An audiophile’s dream
Hideout room is a hidden gem within the venue, designed for immersive music experiences. It features a high-fidelity sound system and 360-degree projection mapping, creating a unique space where visuals and sound meet. It’s become a go-to for audiophiles, live AV performances, and intimate music showcases.

Cultural Significance
Hackney Wick has a rich history as a creative district, with many of its former industrial spaces transformed into artist studios, music venues, and cultural spaces. Number 90 reflects this transformation — preserving the building’s industrial character while reimagining it as a place for community, creativity, and connection.
Food & Drink: Full kitchen and bar service available.
Location: Easily accessible from Hackney Wick Overground station (5-minute walk).

name: Number 90
